content.description:
The following procedures are available for string manipulation.

Procedure Call
Explanation

substring(str, start, end)
Returns a substring of consecutive characters of str starting with the character at position start and ending with the character at position end. The first character of str is considered position 1. For example, substring("delivery", 3, 6) returns "live".

concat(str1, str2)
Returns a single string consisting of str1 followed by str2. For example, concat("key", "board") returns "keyboard".

len(str)
Returns the number of characters in str. For example, len("key") returns 3.

A programmer wants to create a new string by removing the character in position n of the string oldStr. For example, if oldStr is "best" and n is 3, then the new string should be "bet". Assume that 1 < n < len(oldStr).
content.question:
Which of the following code segments can be used to create the desired new string and store it in newStr ?

Select two answers.

choices.label:
left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)
right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))
newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n + 1)
right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n - 1, len(oldStr))
newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)
newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(newStr, substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr)))

newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))
newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(newStr, substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1))

content.answer:
left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)
right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))
newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Use abstraction to manage complexity in a program.
